sn52.7:1.2: There Venerable Anuruddha addressed the mendicants:
sn52.7:2.1: “Reverends, when these four kinds of mindfulness meditation are developed and cultivated they lead to the ending of craving.
sn52.7:2.3: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body …
sn52.7:2.6: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of covetousness and displeasure for the world.
sn52.7:2.7: When these four kinds of mindfulness meditation are developed and cultivated they lead to the ending of craving.”
